question: If a worker can paint a wall in 6 hours, what fraction of the wall can they paint in 1 hour?
details: The rate of work is defined as the portion of a task completed per unit time. If one whole wall is painted in 6 hours, then in 1 hour, the worker completes 1 ÷ 6 = 1/6 of the wall. This is a standard application of the formula: Rate = Work ÷ Time.

question: Two machines can produce 100 widgets together in 2 hours. If one machine works alone and produces 30 widgets in 2 hours, how many widgets does the other machine produce in 2 hours?
details: Together, the machines produce 100 widgets in 2 hours. If Machine A produces 30 widgets in that time, then Machine B must produce the remainder: 100 − 30 = 70 widgets. This uses the principle that combined work equals the sum of individual contributions over the same time period.

question: Alice can wash a car in 4 hours, and Bob can wash the same car in 6 hours. How long will it take them to wash the car together?
details: Alice’s rate is 1/4 car per hour, and Bob’s rate is 1/6 car per hour. Combined rate = 1/4 + 1/6 = (3/12 + 2/12) = 5/12 cars per hour. Time = Work ÷ Rate = 1 ÷ (5/12) = 12/5 = 2.4 hours (or 2 hours and 24 minutes). This uses the standard work-rate addition method.

question: If a tap fills a tank in 10 minutes, what is its rate of filling in tanks per minute?
details: Rate of work is calculated as total work divided by time. Here, filling one tank in 10 minutes gives a rate of 1 tank ÷ 10 minutes = 1/10 tank per minute.

question: Sam can mow a lawn in 3 hours. What part of the lawn can he mow in 45 minutes?
details: First convert 45 minutes to hours: 45 ÷ 60 = 0.75 hours. Sam’s rate is 1/3 lawn per hour. Work done = Rate × Time = (1/3) × 0.75 = 0.25 = 1/4 of the lawn.

question: Two gardeners working together can plant 24 trees in 3 hours. If one gardener plants 5 trees per hour, how many trees does the other plant per hour?
details: Together, they plant 24 trees in 3 hours, so their combined rate is 24 ÷ 3 = 8 trees per hour. If Gardener A plants 5 trees/hour, then Gardener B plants 8 − 5 = 3 trees per hour.

question: A printer prints 180 pages in 15 minutes. What is its printing rate in pages per minute?
details: Rate = Total work ÷ Time = 180 pages ÷ 15 minutes = 12 pages per minute. This is a direct application of the rate formula.

question: If a person can type 300 words in 10 minutes, how many words can they type in 1 minute?
details: Typing rate = Total words ÷ Time = 300 ÷ 10 = 30 words per minute. This is a straightforward calculation of unit rate.

question: Maya can bake a batch of cookies in 20 minutes. What fraction of a batch can she bake in 5 minutes?
details: Maya’s rate is 1 batch per 20 minutes, or 1/20 per minute. In 5 minutes, she completes (1/20) × 5 = 5/20 = 1/4 of a batch.

question: A factory produces 600 toys in 5 days working at a constant rate. How many toys does it produce per day?
details: Daily production rate = Total toys ÷ Number of days = 600 ÷ 5 = 120 toys per day. This uses the basic definition of rate as work per unit time.

question: Tom can read 40 pages in 2 hours. At this rate, how long will it take him to read 100 pages?
details: Tom’s reading rate = 40 pages ÷ 2 hours = 20 pages per hour. Time to read 100 pages = 100 ÷ 20 = 5 hours.

question: Two hoses fill a pool. Hose A fills it in 8 hours, and Hose B fills it in 12 hours. How long will it take to fill the pool if both hoses are used together?
details: Rate of Hose A = 1/8 pool per hour; Rate of Hose B = 1/12 pool per hour. Combined rate = 1/8 + 1/12 = (3/24 + 2/24) = 5/24. Time = 1 ÷ (5/24) = 24/5 = 4.8 hours.

question: A baker makes 36 cupcakes in 3 hours. What is her rate of baking in cupcakes per hour?
details: Rate = Total cupcakes ÷ Time = 36 ÷ 3 = 12 cupcakes per hour.

question: If a cyclist covers 45 kilometers in 3 hours, what is their average speed (rate of travel) in km/h?
details: Although this involves distance, speed is a form of rate (distance per unit time). Rate = 45 km ÷ 3 h = 15 km/h. In work-rate problems, ‘work’ can be any measurable output, including distance.

question: Emma can solve 15 math problems in 25 minutes. How many problems can she solve in 1 hour at the same rate?
details: First, find her rate: 15 problems ÷ 25 minutes = 3/5 problems per minute. In 60 minutes: (3/5) × 60 = 36 problems.

question: If a printer prints 240 pages in 20 minutes, how many pages does it print per minute?
details: Rate = Total work ÷ Time = 240 ÷ 20 = 12 pages per minute.

question: Rahul can build a fence in 10 days. What fraction of the fence can he build in 1 day?
details: Rate of work = 1 complete job ÷ 10 days = 1/10 per day.

question: Two workers together can finish a job in 6 hours. If one worker alone takes 12 hours, how long would the other take working alone?
details: Combined rate = 1/6. First worker’s rate = 1/12. So second worker’s rate = 1/6 − 1/12 = 1/12. Time = 1 ÷ (1/12) = 12 hours.

question: A machine makes 75 bottles in 15 minutes. How many bottles does it make in 1 minute?
Priya reads 90 pages in 3 hours. How many pages can she read in 1 hour?
A tap can fill a bucket in 8 minutes. What part of the bucket is filled in 2 minutes?
Two typists can type 200 words together in 10 minutes. If Typist A types 12 words per minute, how many words per minute does Typist B type?
details: Combined rate = 200 ÷ 10 = 20 words/min. Typist B = 20 − 12 = 8 words/min.

question: If a student solves 24 math problems in 48 minutes, how many problems can they solve in 10 minutes at the same rate?
details: Rate = 24 ÷ 48 = 0.5 problems per minute. In 10 minutes: 0.5 × 10 = 5 problems.

question: A gardener can water 50 plants in 2 hours. How many plants can he water in 30 minutes?
details: Rate = 50 ÷ 2 = 25 plants/hour = 25/60 per minute. In 30 minutes: 25 × 0.5 = 12.5 plants.

question: If it takes 15 minutes to wash 3 cars, how long does it take to wash 1 car at the same rate?
A factory produces 1,200 pens in 8 hours. What is its production rate in pens per hour?
Lena can knit a scarf in 20 hours. What fraction of the scarf can she knit in 5 hours?
Two pipes fill a tank in 4 hours together. One pipe alone fills it in 6 hours. How long would the second pipe take alone?
details: Combined rate = 1/4. First pipe = 1/6. Second pipe rate = 1/4 − 1/6 = (3−2)/12 = 1/12. Time = 12 hours.

question: A baker bakes 18 loaves of bread in 3 hours. How many loaves can she bake in 1 hour?
If a student writes 450 words in 15 minutes, how many words does she write per minute?
A car factory assembles 90 cars in 9 days. How many cars are assembled per day?
Ravi can paint a room in 8 hours. Sita can paint the same room in 8 hours. How long will it take them together?
A photocopier makes 300 copies in 10 minutes. How many copies does it make in 3 minutes?
If a pump empties a tank in 25 minutes, what fraction of the tank is emptied in 5 minutes?
Two students solve 60 problems in 2 hours together. If one solves 18 problems per hour, how many does the other solve per hour?
A seamstress sews 24 shirts in 6 days. How many shirts does she sew per day?
If a robot packs 144 boxes in 12 hours, how many boxes does it pack per hour?
Maya can clean her room in 30 minutes. What part of the room can she clean in 10 minutes?
A farmer harvests 200 kg of wheat in 5 hours. How much does he harvest per hour?
Two candles burn completely in 6 hours and 3 hours respectively. If both are lit together, what fraction of the total wax is burned in 1 hour?
details: Rate of first = 1/6, second = 1/3. Combined = 1/6 + 1/3 = 1/6 + 2/6 = 3/6 = 1/2 per hour.

question: A water tank is filled by a pipe in 12 hours. What fraction is filled in 3 hours?
If a worker earns $180 for 9 hours of work, what is their hourly rate?
details: Rate = Total pay ÷ Hours = 180 ÷ 9 = $20/hour. (Note: Earnings as 'work output' is a valid rate context.)

question: A printer prints 50 pages in 25 minutes. How long does it take to print 1 page?
A team of 3 workers builds a wall in 6 days. If only 1 worker works, how many days will it take?
details: Total work = 3 workers × 6 days = 18 worker-days. One worker takes 18 days.

question: A baker makes 60 cupcakes in 4 hours. How many cupcakes per hour?
If a car travels 180 km in 3 hours, what is its speed in km/h?
details: Speed = Distance ÷ Time = 180 ÷ 3 = 60 km/h (a rate of travel, analogous to work rate).

question: Rohan can wash 4 bikes in 2 hours. How long does it take to wash 1 bike?
A machine produces 1,000 nails in 5 hours. How many nails per hour?
Two people can paint a house in 5 days. If one person paints alone in 10 days, how long for the other alone?
details: Combined rate = 1/5. One person = 1/10. Other = 1/5 − 1/10 = 1/10. So 10 days.

question: A tap fills 30 liters in 6 minutes. How many liters per minute?
If a student completes 1/5 of homework in 12 minutes, how long to complete all?
A factory worker assembles 48 toys in 4 hours. How many toys in 30 minutes?
A hose fills a pool in 20 hours. What fraction is filled in 5 hours?
If a person walks 5 km in 1 hour, how far in 24 minutes?
Two machines make 120 parts in 3 hours. If Machine A makes 25 parts/hour, how many does Machine B make per hour?
A candle burns completely in 4 hours. What fraction burns in 1 hour?
A student reads 200 words in 4 minutes. How many words per minute?
If a pump fills 150 liters in 30 minutes, how many liters per hour?
A tailor stitches 9 shirts in 3 hours. How long for 1 shirt?
details: Time per shirt = 3 hours ÷ 9 = 1/3 hour = 20 minutes.

question: Two gardeners plant 40 trees in 5 hours. What is their combined rate in trees per hour?
A photocopier copies 96 pages in 8 minutes. How many in 5 minutes?
If a worker completes 3/4 of a job in 6 hours, how long for the whole job?
A baker bakes 100 cookies in 2 hours. How many in 45 minutes?
A team of 5 workers finishes a job in 10 days. How long would 10 workers take?
details: Total work = 5 × 10 = 50 worker-days. With 10 workers: 50 ÷ 10 = 5 days.

question: A pipe fills a tank in 9 hours. Another empties it in 18 hours. If both open, how long to fill?
details: Filling rate = 1/9, emptying = −1/18. Net rate = 1/9 − 1/18 = 1/18. Time = 18 hours.

question: A student writes 300 words in 20 minutes. How many in 1 hour?
If 4 identical machines produce 80 units in 2 hours, how many units does 1 machine produce in 1 hour?
A cyclist covers 36 km in 2 hours. How far in 25 minutes?
details: Speed = 18 km/h = 0.3 km/min. In 25 min: 0.3 × 25 = 7.5 km.

question: Two taps fill a tub in 12 minutes together. One tap alone takes 20 minutes. How long for the other alone?
details: Combined rate = 1/12. First tap = 1/20. Second = 1/12 − 1/20 = (5−3)/60 = 2/60 = 1/30. Time = 30 min.

question: A printer prints 1 page every 12 seconds. How many pages in 10 minutes?
A farmer plows 45 acres in 9 days. How many per day?
If a person solves 1 problem every 4 minutes, how many in 1 hour?
A machine labels 600 bottles in 2 hours. How many per minute?
Two students can clean a classroom in 30 minutes. If one takes 60 minutes alone, how long for the other?
details: Combined rate = 1/30. First = 1/60. Second = 1/30 − 1/60 = 1/60. Time = 60 min.

question: A baker needs 4 hours to bake 2 cakes. How long for 1 cake?
A car wash cleans 15 cars in 5 hours. How many cars per hour?
If a tap leaks 2 liters every hour, how much in 15 minutes?
A student finishes a project in 8 days working 3 hours/day. Total work hours?
A photocopier makes 1 copy every 3 seconds. How many in 1 minute?
Two workers dig a trench in 8 hours. One worker alone takes 16 hours. How long for the other?
details: Combined rate = 1/8. First = 1/16. Second = 1/8 − 1/16 = 1/16. Time = 16 hours.

question: A factory produces 1,500 masks in 10 hours. How many per hour?
If a student reads 36 pages in 45 minutes, how many in 1 hour?
A pipe fills 1/3 of a tank in 10 minutes. How long to fill the whole tank?
A chef cooks 18 meals in 6 hours. How many per hour?
Two painters paint a wall in 4 hours. If each works alone in 8 hours, is this consistent?
details: Each rate = 1/8. Combined = 1/8 + 1/8 = 1/4. Time = 4 hours. Consistent.

question: A student types 180 words in 6 minutes. How many in 25 minutes?
A machine stamps 2,400 envelopes in 8 hours. How many per hour?
If a worker builds 1/8 of a wall in 1 hour, how long for the whole wall?
A tap fills a jug in 2 minutes. How many jugs in 1 hour?
Two identical machines produce 50 units in 5 hours. How many units does one produce in 1 hour?
details: Combined rate = 10 units/hour. One machine = 5 units/hour.

question: A cyclist rides 15 km in 45 minutes. How far in 1 hour?
A printer prints 30 pages in 10 minutes. How long for 75 pages?
A farmer harvests 120 kg of potatoes in 4 hours. How much per hour?
If a student completes 2/5 of an assignment in 16 minutes, how long for the whole?
A baker bakes 1 cake every 45 minutes. How many in 3 hours?
Two hoses fill a pond in 6 hours. One takes 10 hours alone. How long for the other?
details: Combined rate = 1/6. First = 1/10. Second = 1/6 − 1/10 = (5−3)/30 = 2/30 = 1/15. Time = 15 hours.

question: A student solves 10 problems in 25 minutes. How many in 1 hour?
A factory packs 900 boxes in 9 hours. How many per hour?
If a pipe fills a tank in 15 hours, what part is filled in 3 hours?
A gardener plants 1 tree every 20 minutes. How many in 2 hours?
Two workers can build a shed in 12 days. If one works alone in 24 days, how long for the other?
details: Combined rate = 1/12. One = 1/24. Other = 1/12 − 1/24 = 1/24. Time = 24 days.

question: A photocopier copies 12 pages per minute. How many in 7 minutes?
A student writes 1 page every 15 minutes. How many pages in 2 hours?
A machine produces 1 part every 6 minutes. How many in 3 hours?
If a person walks 3 km in 36 minutes, how far in 1 hour?
A tap drips 1 drop every 2 seconds. How many drops in 10 minutes?
Two identical printers print 80 pages in 20 minutes. How many pages does one print in 10 minutes?
details: Combined rate = 4 pages/min. One printer = 2 pages/min. In 10 min: 20 pages.

question: A student reads 1/6 of a book in 20 minutes. How long to read the whole book?
A baker makes 5 loaves in 2.5 hours. How many per hour?
A car travels 240 km in 4 hours. What is its speed?
If a worker packs 120 boxes in 4 hours, how many in 15 minutes?
Two students solve 100 problems in 5 hours. If one solves 12 problems/hour, how many does the other solve per hour?
A machine fills 60 bottles in 12 minutes. How many per minute?
A painter paints 1 wall in 5 hours. What part in 1 hour?
A student completes a puzzle in 40 minutes. What fraction is done in 10 minutes?
A factory produces 720 toys in 6 days. How many per day?
If a hose fills a pool in 30 hours, what fraction is filled in 6 hours?
Two workers earn $200 together in 5 hours. If one earns $22/hour, how much does the other earn per hour?
A printer prints 10 pages every 2 minutes. How many in 15 minutes?
A student writes 500 words in 25 minutes. How many per minute?
A tap fills 18 liters in 9 minutes. How many liters per hour?
